data.title: Gauhati University Fees & Courses List 2024
data.meta_description: Browse 16 courses across 142 programs and their fees at Gauhati University. Get the fee structure, duration, specialisation offered for all the courses.

Entrance Exams & Admissions : There is no entrance exam even there is no cut off . They give admission on basis of percentage .They can provide also reservation benefits

Fees & Scholarships : It's INR 7000/ per year. Scholarships are available to students for one year. 5-6 get scholarships from our department. No loans needed.

Fees & Scholarships : It's INR 7000/ per year. Scholarships are available to students for one year. 5-6 get scholarships from our department. No loans needed.

Entrance Exams & Admissions : Entrance test was held for admission.5% was reserved for st/ sc. Entrance Cut of marks was 48.

Academics & Faculty : Daily routines are very regular. Quality of teaching is very good. Good experience.

College Infrastructure & Hostel Facilities : Many hostels are there. 1200/ per month. Pg also available for 4000-5000/pm. Foods are available. Classrooms are excellent.

Clubs & Associations : Good. Youth festivals. Varsity week. A good life in general. Nice to spend time around the campus.

Fees & Scholarships : The course fee for M.Sc was INR 1,000 and sometimes INR 2,500 additional at

Fees & Scholarships : The course fee for M.Sc was INR 1,000 and sometimes INR 2,500 additional at Gauhati University, Guwahati. Only national and state scholarships are available. I don't think loans are needed.

Entrance Exams & Admissions : The eligibility criteria was to pass B.Sc with good percentage . There was no entrance exams held for students registered with Gauhati University . I got my seat under SC quota . There are 3 seats for SC students . My percentage is 73.2 . Cut-off for SC quota was 69. And for general quota the cutoff was 74.

Placements & Internships : No companies hire from here .I don't know about other departments . But no company or placement programs are held for chemistry department.

Academics & Faculty : The chemistry department class routine is very hard to follow. It's starts from 9:00 am to 6 pm. The quality of teaching is poor. Few faculties teach very well. Overall experience was below average.

College Infrastructure & Hostel Facilities : There are hostels in our campus. There is not suffcient hostel rooms for all students but there are many PG's near our campus around 4-8 KM. The food quality is average and costs INR 40-100 per meal. Class rooms are average in our department . Labs are not good. Libraries are good, Wi-Fi is available

Clubs & Associations : There is mainly one students association i.e. PGSU post graduate student union. And there is another union which is of law college under the university. The main festival is Gauhatu University Youth Festilval( or Luit Mohotsav) and the annual sports week and cultural night . And many small programs keeps going on. The university life is okay

Fees & Scholarships : My course fee is INR 2 lakhs for 4 years. From the university, some quota based scholarships are offered. Most of the students in this category get the scholarship. The loans are not required.

Academics & Faculty : Classes start at 9.30

Fees & Scholarships : My course fee is INR 2 lakhs for 4 years. From the university, some quota based scholarships are offered. Most of the students in this category get the scholarship. The loans are not required.

Academics & Faculty : Classes start at 9.30 am and end at 4.30 pm. There is ample scope for projects as the professors are very enthusiastic about them. Assignments differ with subjects. We don't have midterms instead tests are conducted for the total sum of 50 marks. Apart from that, we have semester exams.

College Infrastructure & Hostel Facilities : There are 2 boys hostel and 1 girls hostel. The mess fee is fairly cheap. Rented rooms and PG's are available within a 5km radius across the whole university. Classrooms are quite decent. We have a good Labs and libraries. Each department has their own library. The WiFi is available in all the department as well as hostels. College canteens are good. Food is good and they are cheap.

Clubs & Associations : In my department, we have coding clubs. Student unions are also active in the university and are doing a lot for the whole community. Festivals include Techfest of our department, university week, freshers day, Saraswati puja etc. The college life, in general, is great.

Entrance Exams & Admissions : For taking the B.Tech course at Gauhati University in Gauhati University Institute of Sciences and Technology one has to clear the ASSAM CEE. The cutoff mark for CSE/ECE is 118-120 and for others, it is 85.

Placements & Internships : I haven’t done any internship yet. The companies like TCL, Wipro, Mahindra, Infotech etc come for placements. The alumni network is not bad, they are very helpful.
